item.description: Data Cooperatives and AI Commons S Outline ## Outline ​ describe data markets (any need for surveillance capitalism? https://americancompass.org/essays/selling-the-digital-soul/ ) refer to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/data-futures-lab/data-for-empowerment/shifting-power-through-data-governance/ (gives background on gov models; can also describe tech solutions aswell) describe coops (esp. distinguishing features such as democratic goverance and equal ownership) describe data commons and data coop as new governance forms describe ML value chain

item.title: Article Ideas
item.description: Articles Here are some article drafts and ideas I have been working on for the past 2 months. They cover many areas so drafting has been a bit harder than I would like (T_T). Hopefully, I can get some of these out by the end of October. I will probably start with the GTC and Data Commons articles. Alternatively, I might turn these into podcasts. Drafts very early stage right now

item.title: Article Ideas
item.description: Conf Ideas Here are some thoughts on a conference I have been thinking about for the past 2 months. I think the topic will be convergence, convergent research and global tech commonwealth (GTC), with an example of convergence to thematically set up the conference, and 4 sessions: Presentations Ideation (pick themes and generate questions) Workflows (tutorials, personal workflows) Application (hackathon) Why? I am also working on the need or the why for the conference.

item.title: bikestream
item.description: Bikestream 2021-09-03 Here are some notes on the bikestream project. # Bikestream-based Data Cooperative services based on Platoon Co-ops 2021-09-25 Starting to look into training/coachin programs as a marketplace.

item.title: Bikestream: Databikes for a user-centric mobility future
item.description: Bikestream: Databikes for a user-centric mobility future This article is an intro to the Bikestream project I am putting my thoughts down to come up with a whitepaper for Bikestream. As always, send your feedback to my Twitter account. Outline — 2021–08–06 Purpose Background on coops, mention platform coop (grab from research cooperative article) why alts Describe bikestream benefit for individuals Examples (include purpose and individual benefits) Outline — 2021–08–11 Purpose Background on coops, mention platform coop (grab from research cooperative article) why alts Describe bikestream benefit for individuals Example implementations (crowdsourced bikesharing, bike delivery, self-driving e-bikes) describe mobility cooperatives Purpose To develop a product- and collective-model to support the cooperative sharing of mobility, personal and sensor data from micro-mobility vehicles (or light electric vehicles), and express autonomy over one’s own micro-mobility vehicle’s hardware and software.

item.title: Course Ideas
item.description: Courses I am currently trying to finish making course materials for 2 courses: Introduction to Platform Cooperativism Decentralized and Open Thinking Introduction to Platform Cooperativism Part 2 Part 2 will focus on the drivers of platform cooperativism. This is my outline so far for Part 2, based on these Drivers (the catalysts for the platform cooperativism movement): Digital Labor (Microwork) Social Contracts Monopoly power

item.title: DAO Index
item.description: DGov Score Introduction Here is a short and sweet update on the Distributed Governance (DGov) Score Framework (DGSF). As always, send your feedback to my Twitter account. DAO Index I am trying a new version of the assessment based on the Framework that disconnects the organizing principles of DAOs from: Other digital organizations, Participant experience, and Performance. This assessment specifically focuses on the organizing principles of DAOs (hereafter DAO Index).

item.title: Delivery co-ops taking on GrubHub and others
item.description: Delivery co-ops taking on GrubHub and others Outline Intro mention Grubhub and Doordash (how it operates as a platform and how this harms restaurants and couriers) mention Grubhub and Doordash offenses mention that platform coop model could be a possible cure give examples of platform coops Conclusion refer to https://publicseminar.org/essays/data-cooperatives-for-pandemic-times/ and https://thecounter.org/delivery-apps-grubhub-doordash-charge-restaurants-commission-fees-delivery-co-ops/ for outline help Outline — 2021–08–06 Describe deilvery coops, mention platform coop (grab from research cooperative article) why delivery coop alts Describe delivery coop benefit for individuals Examples (include purpose and individual benefits) Cooperatives Cooperatives Photo by Danielle MacInnes on Unsplash The International Cooperative Alliance (ICA) defines a cooperative as “an autonomous association of persons united voluntarily to meet their common economic, social, and cultural needs and aspirations through a jointly-owned and democratically-controlled enterprise” [2].

item.title: Knowledgebase Previews
item.description: Knowledgebases I am working on a couple knowledgebases for Ledgerback’s Library. The knowledgebases are: Observatory (a knowledgebase monitoring convergent (connection and integration) and pluralistic actors, organizations, movements, events, protocols, networks and more in the alternative internet (i.e., decentralized web, indieweb, Web3, distributed web)), mayve name this the DWeb Convergence Observatory Glossary (a knowledgebase constructing a convergent glossary of terms that span and link across communities in the alternative internet, and grey and academic literature), Tools ( a knowledgebase of tools for spanning the alternative internet, including communities, data-driven apps, social tech, study resources, and more ), DGov_Score-DAO_Index-2021_0921-V0.

item.title: Laplace
item.description: I have my thoughts mostly down but need to make a short introductory article. Outline what do people need to know: answer big Qs what will we do? why crowdfund? benefits for crowdfunders what money will get used for benefits for stakeholders problems to solve addressing problems What is Laplace? Laplace is a learning meta-platform (i.e., stakeholder-owned online university) for knowledge and skill development and exchnage at the knowledge frontier.

item.title: Measuring progress toward the global tech commonwealth
item.description: Tracking %%Measuring%% progress toward the global tech commonwealth An article on how to track %%measuring%% progress toward the global tech commonwealth. As always, send your feedback to my Twitter account. What is the Global Technological Commonwealth? In Distributed Ledger Technologies, Value Accounting, and the Self Sovereign Identity , Dr. Sarah Manski describes the global technological commonwealth (GTC) as: [a] shared imaginary consist[ing] of a post-capitalist society where communities of mutual interest cooperate in the construction of institutions of regenerative economic relations.

item.title: NILS V2.0
item.description: #yellow NILS V2.0 Here is my preliminary notes and work on an update to Nested Inter-Linkage Systems (NILS) . I will be writing V2.X updates in chunks rather than one finished essay. Send your feedback to my Twitter account. 2021-09-21 Name I am thinking of changing the name to Networked-trust Cooperatives (NTCs). 2021-09-17 Identity cooperatives Two possible Identity cooperatives I have thought of are: Reputation Feeds, and Digital Twins.

item.title: Practicing Cooperativism in Web3 — Blockchain Cooperatives
item.description: Practicing Cooperativism in Web3 — Blockchain Cooperatives The rise of glocal sociotechnical cooperative orgaizations and digital cooperativism meeting online communities Outline — 2021–08–11 Describe coops, mention platform coop (grab from research cooperative article), mention ?new cooperativism?, mention difference between formal cooperatives and practicing cooperativism in informal coops (i.e., quasi-coops) mention cooperativism as a practice (principles and values) and how this is permeating the web (making platform coops (also preserving P2P/Commons), democratizing online communities, rise of DAOs/DisCOs and quasi-coops, related movements such as ownership economy annd creator economy, vocabulary (e.

item.title: Rise of Education Platform Coops
item.description: Rise of Education Platform Coops Outline: intro emergence of 2 new edu platform coops what is an edu coop and platform coop (PC)? problems new PCs are meant to address conclusion Outline — 2021–08–06 Describe edu coops, mention platform coop (grab from research cooperative article) why edu coop alts Describe edu coop benefit for individuals Examples (include purpose and individual benefits) Find source on la scuola open source and add it to the edu coop article.

item.title: Tokenization
item.description: A list of Web3 and Tokenization experiments I have been thinking about. Trying out Fuse for Bikestream and Laplace Making a liquidity pool with Balancer Provide memberships to the coop as NFTs through Unlock, use Snapshot for governance, make a Scout Stork NFT, $SCHOLAR tokens to advance the scholarly currency network (mentioned in SDCI slides) Minting an NFT of an article and auctioning it off Tokenizing quizzes

item.title: Tools for thought and cooperatives
item.description: Tools for thought and cooperatives An article on why tools for thought are infrastructural and should be managed by a coop thesis -> collect sources -> create outline -> iteratively draft tools for thought are infrastructural and should be managed by a coop because: TfTs are quasi-public goods knowledge production is best as a CBPP activity and the cultural nature of CBPP can be preserved by coop model platform coop can provide alt.
